GetDelimitedString.summary: Gets the string between the delimiters.
GetDelimitedString.param: Indicates if the parsed value is to be left trimmed.
Indicates if the parsed value is to be right trimmed.
GetDelimitedString.remarks:
Returns null if the begin delimiter is not found.

Includes to the end of the string if the end delimiter is null or not found.

Scrub.remarks: Trims the text, strips slashes and converts HTML characters to HTML entities.

StrPos.summary: Gets the first index for the search value.
StrPos.param: Indicates if a case sensitive search is performed.
StrPos.remarks:
The integer -1 is returned if the search value is not found.

This alternative for PHP strpos() always returns an integer. It can be simply tested for success $index >= 0 or failure $index < 0.

StrRPos.summary: Gets the last index for the search value.
StrRPos.param: Indicates if a case sensitive search is performed.
StrRPos.remarks:
The integer -1 is returned if the search value is not found. It can be simply tested for success $index >= 0 or failure $index < 0.

This alternative for PHP strpos() always returns an integer.

GetFileName.summary: Gets the FileName from the file spec.
GetFileName.remarks:
Parses from the last "/" to the following ".".

Includes to the end of the string if the "." is not found.

GetFileSpecPath.summary: Gets the Path from the file spec.

GetIndexedDebugFileName.summary: Gets the indexed Debug file name.
GetIndexedDebugFileName.remarks:
This function takes a folder name and a file name. It makes sure the folder exists and returns the text "folder/fileName$index" with the extension "txt".

The variable $index in the example file name indicates a unique index value that does not already exist on disk. It begins checking with an index value of 1.

SetSessionValue.summary: Assigns a session value and returns the value.

GetDebugFileName.remarks: This function takes a folder name and a file name. It makes sure the folder exists and returns the text "folder/fileName" with the extension "txt".
